Entries.default: The guard stretches out her hand to halt your advance up the stairs.
"The terrace is reserved for champions. If you wish to observe the battles, you are free to do so - from somewhere else."
"I'll go where I please."
[Walk away.]

"No doubt in your home, that is true."

A few of the nearby peacekeepers turn their attention your way.
"If you wish to see the champion's seating area so dearly, perhaps you should go claim the championship for yourself."
"Did I not make myself clear the first time? Stand aside!"

"Why am I always on duty when the mad ones come calling?"

The peacekeeper unlatches a horn from her belt, and with a loud blast, she rouses the other guards to action.
"Perhaps a few coins might change your mind?"
"Were I so easily bribed, the Faces would have no use for me. Champions only."
"The terrace seating is reserved for champions only."
"Welcome, Champion of the Hunt. Your private seating awaits."
"Need something?"
"Think she recognizes us?"
"I told you we would win, and now we have won!"
"Ac, finally a little recognition! I see my investment in this group is beginning to pay off."
"Huh. To think I fought so hard for a crown and a set of stairs. Hope this at least comes with a free massage - my back's killing me."
"Why would champions wish to be seated in private? Throw us to our adoring fans like chum to the water!"
"And from there we can watch others kill one another, right?"
"Think there's a private bar?"
"Oh we shall be champions, lady guard."
She raises an eyebrow.
"In the meantime, you are not."
"Now go."
